channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: GreenEyes: An Air Quality Evaluating Model based on WaveNet
item.description: Accompanying rapid industrialization, humans are suffering from serious air pollution problems.

item.title: Executing your Commands via Motion Diffusion in Latent Space
item.description: We study a challenging task, conditional human motion generation, which produces plausible human motion sequences according to various conditional inputs, such as action classes or textual descriptors.

item.title: Learning Video Representations from Large Language Models
item.description: We introduce LaViLa, a new approach to learning video-language representations by leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: Editing Models with Task Arithmetic
item.description: Changing how pre-trained models behave -- e. g., improving their performance on a downstream task or mitigating biases learned during pre-training -- is a common practice when developing machine learning systems.

item.title: Generating and Weighting Semantically Consistent Sample Pairs for Ultrasound Contrastive Learning
item.description: In this work, we pre-train DNNs on ultrasound (US) domains instead of ImageNet to reduce the domain gap in medical US applications.

item.title: Cross-view Geo-localization via Learning Disentangled Geometric Layout Correspondence
item.description: We attribute this deficiency to the lack of ability to extract the spatial configuration of visual feature layouts and models' overfitting on low-level details from the training set.

item.title: Deep Model Assembling
item.description: As a result, the additional overhead introduced by the meta model is minimalized.

item.title: A Survey of Graph Neural Networks for Social Recommender Systems
item.description: In this survey, we first identify 80 papers on GNN-based SocialRS after annotating 2151 papers by following the PRISMA framework (Preferred Reporting Items for Systematic Reviews and Meta-Analysis).

item.title: OFASys: A Multi-Modal Multi-Task Learning System for Building Generalist Models
item.description: As a starting point, we provide presets of 7 different modalities and 23 highly-diverse example tasks in OFASys, with which we also develop a first-in-kind, single model, OFA+, that can handle text, image, speech, video, and motion data.

item.title: Leveraging Unlabeled Data to Track Memorization
item.description: We empirically show the effectiveness of our metric in tracking memorization on various architectures and datasets and provide theoretical insights into the design of the susceptibility metric.

item.title: Shadow Removal by High-Quality Shadow Synthesis
item.description: Specifically, the encoder extracts the shadow feature of a region identity which is then paired with another region identity to serve as the generator input to synthesize a pseudo image.

item.title: Vicious Classifiers: Data Reconstruction Attack at Inference Time
item.description: Privacy-preserving inference via edge or encrypted computing paradigms encourages users of machine learning services to confidentially run a model on their personal data for a target task and only share the model's outputs with the service provider; e. g., to activate further services.

item.title: Combining Photogrammetric Computer Vision and Semantic Segmentation for Fine-grained Understanding of Coral Reef Growth under Climate Change
item.description: Corals are the primary habitat-building life-form on reefs that support a quarter of the species in the ocean.

item.title: C-VTON: Context-Driven Image-Based Virtual Try-On Network
item.description: At the core of the C-VTON pipeline are: (i) a geometric matching procedure that efficiently aligns the target clothing with the pose of the person in the input images, and (ii) a powerful image generator that utilizes various types of contextual information when synthesizing the final try-on result.

item.title: Towards Accurate Ground Plane Normal Estimation from Ego-Motion
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel approach for ground plane normal estimation of wheeled vehicles.

item.title: UNETR++: Delving into Efficient and Accurate 3D Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Owing to the success of transformer models, recent works study their applicability in 3D medical segmentation tasks.

item.title: evosax: JAX-based Evolution Strategies
item.description: In order to better harness these resources and to enable the next generation of black-box optimization algorithms, we release evosax: A JAX-based library of evolution strategies which allows researchers to leverage powerful function transformations such as just-in-time compilation, automatic vectorization and hardware parallelization.

item.title: SINE: SINgle Image Editing with Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: We propose a novel model-based guidance built upon the classifier-free guidance so that the knowledge from the model trained on a single image can be distilled into the pre-trained diffusion model, enabling content creation even with one given image.

item.title: ConsistTL: Modeling Consistency in Transfer Learning for Low-Resource Neural Machine Translation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel transfer learning method for NMT, namely ConsistTL, which can continuously transfer knowledge from the parent model during the training of the child model.

item.title: DeeProb-kit: a Python Library for Deep Probabilistic Modelling
item.description: DeeProb-kit is a unified library written in Python consisting of a collection of deep probabilistic models (DPMs) that are tractable and exact representations for the modelled probability distributions.

item.title: Beyond Discrete Genres: Mapping News Items onto a Multidimensional Framework of Genre Cues
item.description: In the contemporary media landscape, with the vast and diverse supply of news, it is increasingly challenging to study such an enormous amount of items without a standardized framework.

item.title: Fast Parallel Exact Inference on Bayesian Networks: Poster
item.description: Bayesian networks (BNs) are attractive, because they are graphical and interpretable machine learning models.

item.title: Fast Parallel Bayesian Network Structure Learning
item.description: The mainstream BN structure learning methods require performing a large number of conditional independence (CI) tests.

item.title: Transfer learning for chemically accurate interatomic neural network potentials
item.description: This work studies the capability of transfer learning for efficiently generating chemically accurate interatomic neural network potentials on organic molecules from the MD17 and ANI data sets.

item.title: CODEBench: A Neural Architecture and Hardware Accelerator Co-Design Framework
item.description: AccelBench performs cycle-accurate simulations for a diverse set of accelerator architectures in a vast design space.

item.title: Learning Action-Effect Dynamics for Hypothetical Vision-Language Reasoning Task
item.description: 'Actions' play a vital role in how humans interact with the world.

item.title: Dock2D: Synthetic data for the molecular recognition problem
item.description: Predicting the physical interaction of proteins is a cornerstone problem in computational biology.

item.title: Teaching Matters: Investigating the Role of Supervision in Vision Transformers
item.description: We compare ViTs trained through different methods of supervision, and show that they learn a diverse range of behaviors in terms of their attention, representations, and downstream performance.

item.title: Cyclically Disentangled Feature Translation for Face Anti-spoofing
item.description: We further extend CDFTN for multi-target domain adaptation by leveraging data from more unlabeled target domains.

item.title: WIDER & CLOSER: Mixture of Short-channel Distillers for Zero-shot Cross-lingual Named Entity Recognition
item.description: In this study, a mixture of short-channel distillers (MSD) method is proposed to fully interact the rich hierarchical information in the teacher model and to transfer knowledge to the student model sufficiently and efficiently.

item.title: Phase2vec: Dynamical systems embedding with a physics-informed convolutional network
item.description: In an auxiliary training period, embeddings are optimized so that they robustly encode the equations of unseen data over and above the performance of a per-equation fitting method.

item.title: Stochastic Rising Bandits
item.description: This paper is in the field of stochastic Multi-Armed Bandits (MABs), i. e., those sequential selection techniques able to learn online using only the feedback given by the chosen option (a. k. a.

item.title: SimVTP: Simple Video Text Pre-training with Masked Autoencoders
item.description: This paper presents SimVTP: a Simple Video-Text Pretraining framework via masked autoencoders.

item.title: RainUNet for Super-Resolution Rain Movie Prediction under Spatio-temporal Shifts
item.description: This paper presents a solution to the Weather4cast 2022 Challenge Stage 2.

item.title: Physics-constrained deep learning postprocessing of temperature and humidity
item.description: Weather forecasting centers currently rely on statistical postprocessing methods to minimize forecast error.

item.title: FSID: Fully Synthetic Image Denoising via Procedural Scene Generation
item.description: To address this, we have developed a procedural synthetic data generation pipeline and dataset tailored to low-level vision tasks.

item.title: Fairness and Explainability: Bridging the Gap Towards Fair Model Explanations
item.description: Although research efforts have been devoted to measuring and mitigating bias, they mainly study bias from the result-oriented perspective while neglecting the bias encoded in the decision-making procedure.

item.title: Image Compression With Learned Lifting-Based DWT and Learned Tree-Based Entropy Models
item.description: This paper explores learned image compression based on traditional and learned discrete wavelet transform (DWT) architectures and learned entropy models for coding DWT subband coefficients.

item.title: ViTPose+: Vision Transformer Foundation Model for Generic Body Pose Estimation
item.description: In this paper, we show the surprisingly good properties of plain vision transformers for body pose estimation from various aspects, namely simplicity in model structure, scalability in model size, flexibility in training paradigm, and transferability of knowledge between models, through a simple baseline model dubbed ViTPose.

item.title: Specifying Behavior Preference with Tiered Reward Functions
item.description: Next, we propose an environment-independent tiered reward structure and show it is guaranteed to induce policies that are Pareto-optimal according to our preference relation.

item.title: Slimmable Pruned Neural Networks
item.description: Slimmable Neural Networks (S-Net) is a novel network which enabled to select one of the predefined proportions of channels (sub-network) dynamically depending on the current computational resource availability.

item.title: iQuery: Instruments as Queries for Audio-Visual Sound Separation
item.description: To generalize to a new instrument or event class, drawing inspiration from the text-prompt design, we insert an additional query as an audio prompt while freezing the attention mechanism.

item.title: GLeaD: Improving GANs with A Generator-Leading Task
item.description: Generative adversarial network (GAN) is formulated as a two-player game between a generator (G) and a discriminator (D), where D is asked to differentiate whether an image comes from real data or is produced by G. Under such a formulation, D plays as the rule maker and hence tends to dominate the competition.

item.title: Spatio-Temporal Self-Supervised Learning for Traffic Flow Prediction
item.description: ii) These models fail to capture the temporal heterogeneity induced by time-varying traffic patterns, as they typically model temporal correlations with a shared parameterized space for all time periods.

item.title: Leveraging Structure for Improved Classification of Grouped Biased Data
item.description: To model the inherent structure in such data, we assume the partition-projected class-conditional invariance across groups, defined in terms of the group-agnostic feature space.

item.title: Reconciling a Centroid-Hypothesis Conflict in Source-Free Domain Adaptation
item.description: We propose to reconcile this conflict by aligning the entropy minimization objective with that of the pseudo labels' cross entropy.

item.title: MEDIAR: Harmony of Data-Centric and Model-Centric for Multi-Modality Microscopy
item.description: Cell segmentation is a fundamental task for computational biology analysis.

item.title: Truthful Meta-Explanations for Local Interpretability of Machine Learning Models
item.description: As a result, the demand for a selection tool, a meta-explanation technique based on a high-quality evaluation metric, is apparent.

item.title: Intervening With Confidence: Conformal Prescriptive Monitoring of Business Processes
item.description: Prescriptive process monitoring methods seek to improve the performance of a process by selectively triggering interventions at runtime (e. g., offering a discount to a customer) to increase the probability of a desired case outcome (e. g., a customer making a purchase).

item.title: Towards Explainable Motion Prediction using Heterogeneous Graph Representations
item.description: In this work, we aim to improve the explainability of motion prediction systems by using different approaches.
